contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} {{BLP sources|date=March 2011}} {{Infobox President | name = Dragan Maršićanin<br>Драган Маршићанин | image = | imagesize = 60px |order= Serbian Ambassador to Switzerland |term_start = 4 July 2004 |term_end = 27 January 2009 |predecessor = |successor = [[Milan St. Protić]] |order2= Minister of Economy |term_start2 = 3 March 2004 |term_end2 = 10 May 2004 |predecessor2 = Post established <br><small>(Split from Ministry of Finance and Economy)</small> |successor2 = [[Zora Simović]]<small> (Acting)</small> <br>[[Predrag Bubalo]] | order3 = [[President of Serbia]]<br><small>Acting</small> | primeminister3 = [[Zoran Živković (politician)|Zoran Živković]] | term_start3 = 4 February 2004 | term_end3 = 3 March 2004 | predecessor3 = [[Nataša Mićić]] <small>(Acting)</small> | successor3 = [[Vojislav Mihailović]] <small>(Acting)</small> | order4 = 6th [[President of the National Assembly of Serbia]]<ref name="B92">{{cite web |url=http://www.b92.net/specijal/izbori2004/kandidati.php?nav_id=140073|author=B92 |authorlink=B92 |title=Konačni rezultati izbora |accessdate=24 June 2004 |date= 24 June 2004 |publisher=B92 |language=Serbian}}</ref> | term_start4 = 22 January 2001 | term_end4 = 6 December 2001 | predecessor4= [[Dragan Tomić]] | successor4 = [[Nataša Mićić]] | term_start5 = 4 February 2004 | term_end5 = 3 March 2004 | predecessor5= [[Nataša Mićić]] | successor5 = [[Predrag Marković]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1950|1|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Belgrade]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Serbs|Serbian]] | spouse = | party = [[Democratic Party of Serbia]] | relations = | children = | residence = | occupation = | profession = Economist | religion = [[Serbian Orthodox]] }} '''Dragan Maršićanin''' (Драган Маршићанин) (born in 1950 in [[Belgrade]]) is a [[Serbia]]n politician. He was the ambassador of [[Serbia]] to [[Switzerland]], serving from 2004 to 2009. He was also [[Serbia]]n Minister of Economy, but his position was put on hold when he decided to run for president in 2004. He later resigned from the position and was replaced by [[Predrag Bubalo]] in October, 2004. In the [[Serbian presidential election, 2004]] Maršićanin finished 4th with 13.3% of the vote. He has been [[President of the National Assembly of Serbia]] in 2001 and 2004 and the interim acting [[President of Serbia]] between 4 February and 3 March 2004. Maršićanin graduated from the [[University of Belgrade]] [[University of Belgrade Faculty of Economics|Faculty of Economics]]. Following university studies, he worked for companies such as ''Elektron'', ''Novi Kolektiv'' and ''Belgrade Water Utility Company''. He has been a member of the [[Democratic Party of Serbia]] since the party's founding. For a time he was the secretary of party, and currently is its vice-president. He served as chairman of [[Vračar]] municipality in Belgrade until 1996. == References == {{Reflist|1}} <ref/1> http://www.b92.net/specijal/izbori2004/kandidati.php?nav_id=140073 == See also == *[[List of Ambassadors from Serbia]] {{s-start}} {{s-gov}} {{succession box|title=[[President of Serbia]]<br><small>Acting</small>|before=[[Nataša Mićić]]<br><small>Acting</small>|after=[[Vojislav Mihailović]]<br><small>Acting</small>|years=2004}} {{succession box |title= [[President of the National Assembly of Serbia]]| | before=''[[Dragan Tomić]]''| | after=''[[Nataša Mićić]]''| | years=2001 }} {{succession box |title= [[President of the National Assembly of Serbia]]| | before=''[[Nataša Mićić]]''| | after=''[[Predrag Marković]]''| | years=2004 }} {{s-end}} {{SerbiaParliamentSpeakers}} {{SerbianPres}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Marsicanin, Dragan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1950 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Belgrade]], Serbia | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Marsicanin, Dragan}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Belgrade]] [[Category:Democratic Party of Serbia politicians]] [[Category:Ambassadors of Serbia to Switzerland]] [[Category:Presidents of Serbia within Yugoslavia]] [[Category:University of Belgrade Faculty of Economics alumni]]
